description: This function draws a line on a 2D plane, with optional points along the line. It is useful for teaching geometry and algebra, and for visualizing mathematical equations.

educational_standards.description: Identify independent and dependent variables in situations.
Interpret graphs presented in word problems, extracting and analyzing quantitative information to explain the relationships shown.
Find the slope of a linear function from a graph.
Find the slope of a linear function from two points.

Use similar triangles to explain why the slope m is the same between any two distinct points on a non-vertical line in the coordinate plane by making the distance between the points the hypotenuse of a right triangle and solving for the ratio of the vertical leg to the horizontal leg.
Write an equation, y = mx, for a line through the origin.
Interpret points on a graph of a linear function.
Write an equation for a linear function of a graph with real world context.
Write an equation in slope-intercept from (y = mx + b) for a graph of a line intercepting the vertical axis at b.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Line on a 2D Plane
stimulus_type_specification.description: This function draws a line on a 2D plane, optionally with points along the line. The line is defined by its slope and y-intercept, and the points are defined by their x and y coordinates. The line and points are drawn on a 2D plane with a specified x and y range. This function is useful for teaching geometry and algebra, and for visualizing mathematical equations.

details: Axis: Defines the x and y range of the 2D plane
Line: Defines the slope and y-intercept of the line
Point: Optional, defines the x and y coordinates of points along the line
Axis: Both x and y range are required
Line: Both slope and y-intercept are required
Point: Both x and y coordinates are required if a point is specified
Draws a line on a 2D plane, with optional points along the line
The line is defined by its slope and y-intercept
The points are defined by their x and y coordinates
